title: Sale docs out for Downer's mining, attention on proceeds
text:
The asset sales are flowing thick and fast out of Downer Group.

As its subsidiary Spotless ramps up plans to sell its commercial laundries business, Downer's also in the market with sale documents for its contract mining arm.

Downer CEO Grant Fenn has his advisers at Macquarie testing buyer appetite for the mining services business. Nick Moir

It is understood auctioneers Macquarie Capital has signed a bunch of would-be buyers to confidentiality agreements and distributed an information memorandum, with plenty of numbers detailing where the business has been and where management wants it to go.

The sale - as we revealed in August - is all about taking Downer one step closer to CEO Grant Fenn's vision of a capital-light soft services company.

While it is too early to say who will buy Downer's mining services arm, or whether there is even a $700 million-odd bid to wrangle it free, the company and its bankers are pushing pretty hard towards securing a buyer.
description: The asset sales are flowing thick and fast out of Downer Group.
